title: Processes - Average Value of a Function

content.question: Let <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the function given by <math alttext="f of x, equals, open parenthesis, x squared, plus x, close parenthesis, times, the cosine of, open parenthesis, 5 x, close parenthesis " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>. What is the average value of <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> on the closed interval <math alttext="2 is less than or equal to x, is less than or equal to 6 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

topic.text: 8.1: Finding the Average Value of a Function on an Interval

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
